basics.name: Kayla Kwock
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Engineering in the from the College of Engineering  at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2020.

work.summary: Work with a team of other interns to develop a solution along with a business pitch "Shark Tank" style.
highlights: Used Agile PM methodologies to develop a Python-based application.
Pitched product to various staff, including senior members.

work.summary: Mentor 4-12th grade students to complete multi-month robotics projects using Engineering Design principles.
highlights: Students participated in VEX IQ, VRC, and FRC robotics competitions both locally and off-island.
Work with other mentors and student leaders to develop project road maps using Scrum.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with an overall GPA of at least 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.summary: Scholarship awarded to incoming freshmen who exemplify drive and devotion to their education.
